New issue

configurable umask for unix socket #85

Closed
pietern opened this Issue Sep 20, 2011 · 2 comments

Labels

non critical bug

Milestone

No milestone

Assignee

No one assigned

3 participants

pietern commented Sep 20, 2011

The default umask (usually 022) can be overridden by the process starting Redis (e.g. to 000 to allow any user to connect to Redis over its Unix socket), but this also changes the permission mask for the log, snapshot and AOF. I think it would be good to add a configuration directive to explicitly set the mask for a unix socket, so a permissive unix socket doesn't necessarily impacts the permission settings on the other files Redis creates.

For example:

unixsocket /tmp/redis.sock
unixsocketperm 755 # As safe default, user can specify 777

This integer can be passed directly to chmod(2).

What do you think?

Owner
antirez commented Sep 20, 2011

Makes sense to me, I agree that a specific option is the best pick. As a sole possible alternative I would simply set it to 777 by default if there are no concerns about that.

If we go for the config directive, are you sure we don't need to convert it into an octal number before passing it to chmod? If I remember correctly you pass it as an octal value to chmod as well, like 0777, so if the user writes "777" in the config file we need to operate a conversion.

florean referenced this issue from a commit Oct 9, 2011
Commit has since been removed from the repository and is no longer available.
florean referenced this issue from a commit in florean/redis Oct 9, 2011
florean Added a config directive for a Unix socket mask … 
Added a configuration directive to allow a user to specify the
permissions to be granted to the Unix socket file.  I followed
the format Pieter and Salvatore discusses in issue #85 (
antirez#85).
